website_summaries.verdict: A great choice for a small family or an individual who just wants a few cups of fresh coffee.
pros: Grinds enough for a full 12-cup pot of coffee
Small enough to store on the counter

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat it. Burr shmurr.
customer_reviews.text: I've tried super expensive grinders, butt grinders, auto grinders and I keep coming back to this one. NY Times goes on and on about the need for a burr grinder to get a consistent grind to avoid bitter coffee, but I think that's getting way too laboratory soecific. 99 percent of people won't know the difference. You'll get a consistent (enough) grind out of this if you know what you're doing and give it a little time for trial and error to get a specific grind dialed in. I use a Bialetti Italian press and this grinder helps me make fantastic and consistent coffee all day, every day.
customer_reviews.author: James Morrison

customer_reviews.title: Study this description closely...
customer_reviews.text: This productwould probably be great if all I wanted to do with it was grind spices. As a coffee grinder, it will only work if you need to grind enough for a 4-cup coffee maker. (The descriptor stating 12-cups is quite misleading.) Also, you can't overfill it with beans--if you do, it doesn't grind at all. AND, the little engine gets pretty hot, which only adds to my frustration at having not just purchased a burr. My Cuisinart coffee maker? Now, that's five-star awesome; this little grinder, not so much. BUT, had I read the descriptor more closely, it does give little clues that it might be a little grinder...
customer_reviews.author: kris10_ch

customer_reviews.title: Plastic start tab broke at first grind.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't even get to grind one batch. The tiny plastic tab which pushes down the motor start mechanism broke off on the first push. Sending this back same day I got it.
customer_reviews.author: Skyland

customer_reviews.title: Bought in 2009
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure if these are still good, but I bought one in 2009 and it’s still grinding. It gets less use than it used to, and I’ve had to tweak it a little but it still runs strong.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Works better than any other coffee grinder I've had.
customer_reviews.text: I was a little startled to see the manual says not to grind spices in it. I decided to do so anyway, since that's what I bought it for. I can't believe how quickly and quietly it pulverizes things like flax seeds. Update: I bought a second one of these, so now I have one for coffee and one for spices. The first one os still going strong. The only way this could be better is if it had a slightly larger, removable cup, so that you could use it for wet and dry grinding. There are some like that on the market, but they have very mixed reviews.
customer_reviews.author: KDA

customer_reviews.title: Nice, even grind.

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart DCG-20BK Coffee Bar Coffee Grinder, Black

That would have been a concern with a larger appliance but since I know better than to expect that this small inexpensive appliance is "fixable," it wasn't a consideration. Hope it holds up as well as people report it does. Fingers crossed.

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware!

I think it's a knock-off/counterfeit. Returned the item as defective.

customer_reviews.title: Okay

It works, the coffee beans are ground equally and just like they need to be. Only complaint is it is hard to measure how much you need and there is no way to would ground enough for more than 10 cups unless you have the weakest coffee known to man. Overall, it will do for now, but I'm sure I'll buy another one eventually.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect grinder for French press coffee
customer_reviews.text: I have wasted so much money on coffee grinders - I use a French press daily to make my cups of coffee and the grinders always grind the coffee too finely for a French press and they create static so the coffee grinds to everywhere. I recently stayed at a Airbnb and they had this coffee grinder, I used it and instantly fell in love. With a few quick presses of the triangular button it grinds the coffee beans into coarse pieces perfect for a French press, plus the amount of coffee it grinds is perfect AND no clean up! I dump the grinds straight into my French press for the perfect morning coffee. The price is unbeatable.

product_meta.title: Cuisinart Coffee Bar Coffee Grinder, White
product_meta.description:
Color:WhitePair your coffeemaker with the Cuisinart Coffee grinder to bring out the freshest flavor from your whole beans. With a simple on/off switch, you can grind enough 70g/2. 5oz of coffee beans to make 12 fresh Cups in no time. This handy grinder also makes quick work of grinding spices and herbs, including peppercorns and fresh basil- just remember which Coffee grinder you use for prep work!

AMAZON.COM
With Cuisinart's handsome, compact coffee grinder, it's easy to always have fresh coffee made to exact specifications. Its clean lines and teardrop shape make the grinder easy to hold, and it runs with the push of a button in its lid. To use, simply measure coffee beans into the bowl, replace the lid, and hold down the button until the coffee is ground to the desired consistency. Unplug the grinder when it's not in use--the cord can be stored in the base of the unit. --Jennifer Harris
